column1: '''Denys Gueroult''' [[Order of the British Empire|MBE]] ([[25 September]] [[1927]]<ref>{{webcite|website=[http://www.findthecompany.co.uk/ FindTheCompany]|articleurl=http://directors.findthecompany.co.uk/l/280720/Denys-Gueroult|articlename=Denys Gueroult - Director Profile|accessed=16 December 2014}}</ref> - [[29 July]] [[2014]]<ref>{{webcite|website=[https://www.thegazette.co.uk/ The Gazette]|articleurl=https://www.thegazette.co.uk/notice/2200711|articlename=Denys Gueroult - Deceased Estates|accessed=16 December 2014}}</ref>) was a [[BBC]] producer responsible for a [[Index:Audio recordings of J.R.R. Tolkien|recorded interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[January]] [[1965]]
Denys Gueroult is the spelling used in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]'' and [[Minas Tirith Evening-Star (Volume 8
column3: Number 2)]]. Variant spellings in different works are: Denis
column9: Gerroult. In the archives of the [[Marquette University]]
column12: Audio Visual Material: Secondary Material relation to Tolkien
